department: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
duration_in_months: For one year with option to extend for another three years
full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement

#### Notice of Proposial

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) is seeking a Webmaster (Level 2) to provide professional services for web development, testing, publishing, analytics services, and related duties in support of the EduCanada web projects.

#### Contract Details

*   Contract Title: TBIPS – Webmaster (Level 2) - Web Development Services Contract for EduCanada
*   Solicitation Number: 23-230379
*   Reference Number: 23-230379
*   Contract Duration: One (1) year, with three (3), one (1) year option periods
*   Estimated Delivery Date: January 16, 2023

#### Tendering Information

*   Solicitation Method: Competitive
*   Notice of Proseduction (NPP): Yes
*   Categorization: Stream 1: A.17 Webmaster, Level 2
*   Trade Agreements: Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, and others.

#### Eligibility

Only qualified Supply Arrangement (SA) holders are eligible to submit a proposal. The Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and other applicable trade agreements apply to this solicitation.

#### Security Requirement

Common PS SRCL #19 applies. The minimum corporate security required is Secret, and the minimum resource security required is Secret.

#### Inquiries

Inquiries regarding this RFP requirement must be submitted to the Contracting Authority named above. Request for Proposal (RFP) documents will be e-mailed directly from the Contracting Authority to the Qualified Supply Arrangement Holders who are being invited to bid on this requirement.

**Point of Contact:**

*   Kingsley Knight
*   Phone: 343-203-8234
*   Email: [Kingsley.Knight@international.gc.ca](mailto:Kingsley.Knight@international.gc.ca)

**Important Notes:**

*   The Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) Method of Supply is subject to quarterly refresh cycles.
*   prospective bidders must review the solicitation document for details.

### Target Audience:

*   Government Agencies
*   IT Contractors
*   Web Development Firms

### Relevant Experience:

*   Web development and maintenance
*   Web analytics and SEO
*    Experience with web development tools and software
*
